Paper.Title: Guiding a Well-Founded Parser with Corpus Statistics

Section.Paragraph: We present a parsing system built from a hand-written lexicon ~ and grammar, and trained on a selection of the Brown Corpus. On the sentences it can parse, the parser performs as well as purely corpus-based parsers. Its advantage lies in the fact that its syntactic analyses readily support semantic interpretation. Moreover, the system's hand-written foundation allows for a more fully lexicalized probabilistic model, i.e.
one sensitive to co-occurrence of lexical heads of phrase constituents.
